Maka was in a foul mood as she walked down the streets of Death City that Saturday afternoon, yet again her lousy partner ditched her to hang out with Black*Star and left her with a large list of groceries to buy. So Maka felt totally alone and deserted, she grumbled as she walked back home, with several brown paper bags full of groceries, only to find the door open when she got there. She quietly set the sacks down on the sidewalk, knowing that she might not be as physically strong as Black*Star, but she could definitely take out some no good punk, today of all days especially.

As soon as she got outside however, a gust of wind blew the bags over and scattered the groceries all across the street, which were then run over by a passing truck.

Maka stood there in shock for a moment, until the always tactful Black*Star came to her side and bluntly said "That sucks for you Maka!"

That was when something happened, Maka suddenly found herself in a dark room, clothed in a fancy dress. "Where am I?" She looked around confusedly when her eyes fell upon a short blue man with horns and dressed in a pinstripe suit and tie. He was clearly a demon of some sort, but Maka never expected them to come in dwarf size. She couldn't help but hold her sides and laugh. The small demon man waited til her laughter faded before clearing his throat and saying "My dear does it matter where you are? What matters is that you're here now, and its time to have a bit of fun! Don't you remember how hard you've worked for your partner Soul? How you cook and clean and shop for the groceries with no help?"

Maka seemed to have forgotten until the little demon man mentioned it, now her expression darkened. "You're right, I do the most work out of the two of us! And not just in those situations! When we're resonated too! He's always making me pull his heavy scythe ass around!" She stamped a heeled foot, and didn't notice the demon get a wide toothy grin.

"Now you're finally seeing the truth, so come with me through the doorway, its time you got a long needed rest." He took her hand, and led her through a door that seemed to have appeared out of nowhere, brightly lit with white light so that she couldn't tell what was on the other side.

(Outside of Maka's Mind)

Maka hadn't lost consciousness or anything like that, in fact she was as normal in appearance as could be, and seemed to just be really REALLY REALLY pissed off, oh and she was growing, but strangely her clothes were growing too. She was screaming in rage as she shot up in height, and Black*Star was staring up at her, thinking she was just trying to outdo him as the "biggest" person in Death City.

Maka stopped growing at a whopping 60 ft. in height, and when she stopped screaming (which had been getting louder and louder with her growth until her voice had shattered windows. 1552222222222121221.content:
Things started off like they often did. You woke up, got ready and headed to Central for duty. After flashing an ID the guard let you right on in. Instantly you were greeted by the sight of a squad of new recruits doing practice runs around the base. A small smile crept on your face as you remembered those hellish days when you were a rookie. But that was all in the past, now you were a soldier. A low-ranked soldier, but a soldier all the same. Nothing was any different, for about two seconds.

One footstep later you saw a streak of red and fell flat on your back. You had a slight moan but opened your eyes regardless, right overhead was this bulking suit of armor. You recognized the figure as Alphonse Elric. The hulking figure shook his head, “Sorry, we’re in a rush and my brother doesn’t pay any attention.” His eyes jotted back up, “Hey wait up!” Alphonse began to run after the streak of red you saw before.

He’s a lot shorter than I thought. You thought to yourself. It wasn’t every day someone got to meet the Elric Brothers. Famous alchemists, the both of them. You wanted to be one some day but for now you dabbled here and there…speaking of…The C.O. was nowhere to be seen, perhaps this would be a good chance to dabble a bit. An eager grin crept on your face as you ran to your own little locker at the base. No one was there to see as you pulled out a small book and a couple basic alchemy ingredients. You were a soldier but what you really wanted more than anything was to be an alchemist, so when this book appeared on the market you were all for it. So far you only did small stuff, but perhaps it was time to bump it up a notch.

Flipping through the book you passed your typical transmutation circle and found one a bit more complex. “Perfect.” A couple minutes later and you had the symbol written on a fine piece of paper. It…looked correct. But you were impatient and quickly slid a couple coins over the design. The plan was simple; turn the coins into one bigger coin, basic combination stuff. But when you put your hands down to activate that circle all you saw was white.

It was like you had entered a voice of complete nothingness. The lack of color blinded you more than anything you had ever encountered before. Once the bright light began to die down you couldn’t help but sigh in relief. The transmutation definitely went wrong to have that result, but you got off scot free. No damage, no missing limbs, nothing crazy…And then you realized where you were.

It was a house. That much was obvious. But it wasn’t one you had ever seen before. It seemed to be modestly furnished and tidy in an almost obsessive way. Way in the distance were two dog bowls marked Hayate. Thankfully the owner of those bowls didn’t seem to be present. It looked like you were in a living room, a couple couches, a television, a table and a door directly in front of you.

While being transported to a random house wasn’t as bad as it could’ve been, something else had happened. This house was enormous. As in you were a speck along the wooden floors. The realization brought goose bumps. You had heard of alchemy going wrong before, but never shrinking and teleporting! Regret began to form instantly. But you had no time to fret; a loud click was coming from the door. You froze, unsure of what to expect. The doorknob turned and slowly the door opened. The woman who stepped inside made you gasp, because you knew her.

Riza Hawkeye, your C.O. A beautiful, beautiful woman with a body to die for, but she was one of the scariest women you had met in your life. And here she was, gigantic. Knowing her if she didn’t crush you right off the bat she’d torture you for derelicting your duties, even if it wasn’t your fault. You continued to stare, debating on asking for help or not from the scary woman.

Unaware of the small bug staring at her, Riza took off her military jacket and tossed it on her couch. You may have been terrified, but the sight of your boss’ body in that tight black shirt caught your attention. Scary of not, Riza was attractive, with two large breasts you found your eyes stuck on. Still acting casually, Riza began to kick off her boots and place them neatly by the door. Glancing down for a moment you caught sight of her bare feet. Riza’s toes wiggled in the fresh air and reminded you of your situation. Those toes were bigger than you were. All it would take it a single step and you’d be paste.

She might torture me but I’d rather go through than then die. You began to jump up and down crying out for your commanding officer. Any hopes you had began to lower once Riza turned and began walking towards you. Her eyes showed she hadn’t even heard your shrunken cries for help. Realizing it was futile to continue shouting your attention turned to the incoming pair of feet walking towards you. Each step seemed like they covered miles and were coming in fast. Right as the edge of Riza’s shadow began to drape over you you turned and began to run away. It didn’t cross your mind how futile this was. She did in one step what would take you fifteen minutes at least. The looming form of the giantess grew closer and closer, and seemed to get bigger and bigger.

You turned your head to check. All the color left your face. Directly overhead were the toes you feared so much. Between them you saw a glimpse of the giantess far above, face blotted out by her chest. It sunk in how doomed you were, just as the ball of Riza’s foot lowered onto you. The squishy footflesh enveloped you almost like a snare. It was pushing you deeper and deeper into the folds of foot, which you noticed had a faint layer of sweat over it. The salty liquid got into your eyes and stung, only adding to the immense pain of millions of pounds crushing all of its weight onto your little frame, but…nothing else. No bones shattering. No blood. You weren’t dying, you were just being forced several feet into the ball of Riza’s foot. With each step only sending you deeper into it, all you could do was sit there in pain and hope for the best.
1552222222222121221.title: In the Hawk's Nest

1552222222222222232212112.content:
You sit in the taxi seat beside your mother, her hips only a foot away from you. You crane your neck up at her and lock eyes with her. She smiles softly down at you, and says something.

"You know, it's not too late to change your mind."
"Yeah," you say, holding the side-button of your voice amplifier, "I know. But it'll be fine. My quirk makes me stronger!"
"It's going to be dangerous, Chase. You know your quirk only gives you a bit of resistance. You're not invincible."
"Don't you remember that time I fell into your shoe by accident, and you walked around with me as your personal insole all day? I was fine then."

"Yes, but-"
"And that time I tried to scare you by hiding in your sandwich, but instead you just chewed me up and swallowed me?"

"Chase, you've gotta-"
"And just an hour ago where I was waiting in the taxi, but you didn't know so you sat on me and waited 10 minutes for sis to bring me out, but I was just under your big butt?"
"Don't talk about my butt!" She took a breath to calm down. "But Chase, Hero Academy is a lot more dangerous than being stepped on or sat on. It's saving lives, and fighting villains, who will also try to step or sit on you."
"Don't worry. I can take it!"

You struck a hero pose before falling over as the taxi jerked it's way to a stop.
"Well, I guess this is the last time I'll see you for a while," your mother said, reaching over you to open the taxi door, "I'll send you cookies and letters whenever I can."
You give a knowing nod, before jumping out with your tiny back pack. The taxi drives away, and the school doors are just ahead.

Hero Academia, you finally made it.

"It's truly a sight to behold," you say to yourself, "I assume. I can't really see the school past these big metal doors. I mean, they couldn't have put a window or something?"

You take a step forward, before a surprise shoe crushes you. Looking up, hoping to catch the source of your sudden pain, you see a bottom-heavy girl running towards the doors. "I'm going to be late, " she screams, "open the doors!"

The doors slide apart, and as the girl moves out of the way, you see it: Hero Academia. The school was massive, even considering your tiny size, and the school grounds were wide and stretched for miles! You could see student's doing laps, some were playing baseball, and some just laid out in the grass. This was going to be awesome!

Quickly realizing that walking wouldn't cut it for you, you decide to take a ride on one of the coming students.

To your left were a very tall and busty looking girl with long, black hair, making stuff "appear" out of her skin, and a girl with wide hips and brown bowl cut making said stuff float.

To the right, a frog-looking girl with her tongue sticking out, and a sexy pink girl with spiky afro and horns. It also looked like they were talking with the air around them, almost as if there was some sort of invisible girl with them.

Which side do you pick?
1552222222222222232212112.title: 3 Inches

Okay then, you've got to choose. For the next choice, which girl are you going to-

Before you even had a chance to choose an option, you felt a familiar force smash into you from above. Looking above and around, you couldn't find the source, there was just empty space between the pink and frog ladies, almost as if there was an invisible girl who accidentally stepped on you. Not only that, but the invisible force that just crushed you then stuck to you (or rather, you stuck to it) and it carried you softly into the air. But as quickly as it lifted you, it slammed you back to the ground again, crushing you again.

Suddenly, though...

1552222222222222232212122.content:
How do they find clothes in your size?! You could use a single snip of thread as a blanket at that size!

Anyways...

Welcome...
To Hero Academy!

"Oh my... I finally made it!" You look up at the goddess-sized gates infront of you, the bars and walls looming higher than anything you've ever seen.

You prepare to take your first step towards it, but stop as a shoe lands a foot away, the force and wind of the impact knocking you to the lip of the sidewalk. Before you have a chance to look at the owner, she's off somewhere else.

You pat the dust off of yourself and start walking, towards the gate. It takes a minute or two for you to reach the next brick in the sidewalk. That's when you remember your rocket board, a lightweight rocket-powered skateboard that makes you go just as fast as any regular sized person!

You pull it out and toss it onto the ground. Planting both feet onto it, you flick the switch on the side and start zooming towards the gates, leaving a tiny trail if smoke in it's wake that could be seen by a regular person if they looked closely.

You were within walking distance from the gate, so you knelt down to reach the switch to turn the board off.
Click
You weren't slowing down.
Click click
Nope, still racing.
Click click click click click
"It's not working!"
BANG!
You and your board were going so fast you shot a hole all the way through the gate. And you still weren't slowing down.
"H-Help!!" You know no one could hear you, even if students were scattered across the school grounds, but you didn't know what else to do.

Looking up, you saw a wide variety of panties from the girls you rode underneath. You were so distracted that you failed to notice the bread crumb from someone's breakfast on the ground, directly infront of you.
Your skateboard shot into the air, leaving you behind crashing on the ground. Your eyes rode up the thin trail of grey smoke from your broken transport before a sudden orange 'poof' rose up at the end, like a signal flare of a man lost at sea.

Looking up is shock and awe, your only way if getting around now gone, you stood frozen, even when the booming sounds of Earth shaking grew closer and closer. A shadow descended over you, growing bigger as the shaking got stronger.
You looked over your shoulder and saw a girl, a colossal giantess, her face hidden by shadows from the sun behind her.

She stops, her feet a few feet away from you. Kneeling down, you get a better sense of her features, but still too dark to see much. What you do see, though, is her eyes scanning to ground before locking in on you. Unsure of what to do, you freeze up, simply waving at the gigantic titan looming above you.

"Hey," her voice was like a goddess calling from heaven, it was booming yet sweet toned, "I saw that little poof over, and I thought I'd check it out." She looked over at the bubble of light smoke that was still there. "Was that you?"

"Um... yeah. My rocket board malfuctioned and exploded. Now I pretty much can't go anywhere."

"Aw, you poor thing. Here, let me help you. Where are you going?" She brought her hand forward towards you, signaling you to hop on. It was terrifying, as each finger was nearly 5 times your height zooming at you (to your perspective). But you kept your cool, because that's what heros like you do!

"Okay," you say, trying to stay calm, "I'm going to Class 1-A." You get a running start before leaping onto her finger and climbing onto the palm of her hand.

"Oh, you're a student! That's... Good for you, for trying!" She lifted her hand up as she stood her full height. "I'm actually going there myself, we can be class mates!"

As she started walking towards the school, more and more light started hitting her face. Who was she?

155222222222222223222111.content:
Another day at the office...

Retsuko sighs and looks around her space, feeling very bored. "I just want to DESTROY this place, but of course I can't just DO that... Ugh! I don't wanna be fired..." She lets out a noise of defeat as she drops her head down onto the computer keyboard, causing it to open up the browser. She raises her head and looks at it. "What's this?" she asks, looking at the screen while it displays a weird ad for a new magic store just a block away:

"Want to destroy that place but of course you can't just do it since you don't want to be fired? Well I've got JUST the thing for you~!"

Retsuko squints her eyes and looks closer at the screen to truly understand what it means. "It doesn't even say what it is though... Hm..." She clicks on it curiously, being redirected to a website that is full of images of giant women having dominant rampages through cities. "That's...kind of fun-looking," Retsuko admits, viewing the images. "They don't really mean to make people this crazy big now, do they?"

Then, she looks up at the clock, mumbling angrily to herself as she still has many hours of work left before she may leave. "This is hopeless..." She is still looking up at the clock when the computer makes a quick "beep" noise to display a new notification on the screen. "Huh...?" She looks back at the monitor:

"Is this hopeless? Don't wait any longer and hurry to us for the life-changing solution you NEED!"

This is when the message suddenly leaves after both the name AND direction of the advertiser are displayed. "Guess I'll have a look later?" she asks, quickly writing it down to remember for later.

Retsuko nods her head slowly a few times in understanding, her face tired and sleepy. The next tick of the clock is especially loud, too, making her look up at it...

"*Sigh*, geez..."

She angrily slams a paw down onto the desk, accidentally hitting the mouse which is quick to delete all of her recent work.

"HRRRRGH—!!!"
155222222222222223222111.title: Retsuko

1552222222222222232221111.content:
"Finally, I'm DONE with today..."

Retsuko shakes her head with a tired sigh while walking out of the office. She is so tired that she almost forgets that she had planned on going to that strange place that appeared on her computer screen during the day. "That's right, I was gonna go see that...place..."

She looks both ways on the street before carefully crossing over to the next block, right where the place is. Once there, the red panda is met with a very small building that matches perfectly with the given address on the ad from earlier. "Guess that explains why I've never really...uh, seen or HEARD of the place before..." She steps inside.

All around the tiny building are many antiques and framed images of giantesses destroying fictional places; perhaps that truly is their thing here. "Um, hello? Anyone here? I got your ad today..." Retsuko continues walking down a thin hall before she finds someone. "Uh...hi?" Retsuko receives no response from the hooded figure. No, she instead finds herself being led into a tiny room by said figure. Along the way, she internally notes her sudden interest in the small items and decorations in here. "Nice, I guess?"

"OK so you saw my ad today right? I'm really glad since I've never had anyone actually come to this place."

Right away, Retsuko can't tell whether or not this character is male or female, but she DOES know that she is very curious about what this place is, and how she can possibly benefit from having arrived here.

"Well, yeah, but...I don't...really know what this is about. Is it a...place to buy something, or...?" she asks.

. . .

"This is a place where dreams come true, you know? As in, help you accomplish what you've been hoping to accomplish."

"But I just don't get it—you sound more calm than assuring if that's what you were going for..."

. . .

Retsuko sees a faint smile on the lower half of the face after she asks that.

"What? Did I say something wrong?" Retsuko asks worriedly, a paw up to her mouth.

"No, no, of COURSE not. No, what you've asked is exactly what I was expecting to hear tonight."

"Yeah, so...?"

. . .

Retsuko turns around and quickly locates the exit, feeling very uncomfortable about this now. "So ate you going to do something to me noe or what?" She can feel a hint of impatience begin to take her body over, and she has not even gotten herself drunk yet:

"Yeah, OK, I'll give you my deal now. You don't like your job too much huh? Always being placed so low, and being made to work so hard, boo hoo..."

"Well, yeah, I... Wait how'd you know? I don't even KNOW you, do I? What's with the hood? Come on, I want to at least see you..."

With a worried and concerned look on her face, Retsuko reaches her paw forward in attempt to remove the hood from the other presence in the room, but she is quickly stopped.

"No no, I wouldn't really do that if I were you, you see..."

. . .

Retsuko shakes her head, seemingly unable to take any more of this strangeness. "Should I get going now? I REEEALLY think I should get going now..." She gets up from her chair and begins to walk away, but the door immediately locks down. "What the? Why did you...?"

She turns her head back and watches as the other being in the room stands up and approaches her. "Want to have a little fun? A little fun...de-STROYING this place and making everyone else your slaves?"

They hand her a small pair of bottles. "Huh?" Retsuko asks as she looks down at the small bottles in her paws:

"What are these?"

"These are magical potions that will make that idea real. This one here will make you a goddess, while the other one over there will make others tiny, weak, and helpless little slaves~"

Then, Retsuko looks at the potions, trying to figure it out in her head. "How so?" she asks, looking back up at the other presence in the room. "That's for you to discover. Now have fun~"

Following a sudden noise, the door opens back up to allow Retsuko out of the room. "Hehe, I'm afraid this is going to have to be the first place to go, huh?" the hooded merchant says with a chuckle. Meanwhile, Retsuko steps out of the building altogether, a worried but intrigued look on her face. "They said I'll have fun with both of these, but...which to try first?"
1552222222222222232221111.title: Later on...

15522222222222222322211111.content:
(You know, I think I'm getting a little excited about this, and since I'm going to REALLY show them what I think, I'd better do this in the morning...) she thinks to herself with a bright, enthusiastic smile on her face. "Yeah, I will..."

She waits for the next day.
15522222222222222322211111.title: The "Goddess" potion it is. Tomorrow.

155222222222222223222111111.content:
Retsuko eagerly arrives at work in the morning, Goddess potion in her paw. She stands outside of the place, pleasantly recalling the giantess dream that she had last night while sleeping. "Now then, I guess it's time to put its power to use." Waiting for no one to be looking at her, she quickly chugs the potion, noting its unique taste.

Retsuko stands back and looks at herself, wondering when the potion will take its full effect on her. "Maybe it's not even going to work in the end...? Hm..."

She steps inside.

. . .

Just then, she feels a (thankfully) painless pressure in her stomach, probably being the first reaction from the potion. "Is it gonna work?" she asks curiously, looking down at her belly with immense anticipation. The pressure only becomes more and more noticeable. "Is this all it is, or—"

Retsuko has hardly any time to react when she immediately springs up in height and size. "Whoa!" she exclaims, growing taller and taller than the bigger.

Everyone inside stops what they are doing and they scramble to see what is going on. Some were by the windows, watching the huge red panda body as it fully obstructs their view, and as for the group that went outside, they are immediately taken away by the newly GIGANTIC form of their former co-worker.

Retsuko smiles to herself, instantly falling in love with the sight of the miniscule bugs at her paws, all watching her in fear. "Hello, my fellow workers~" When she begins to speak, many step back in complete horror of her. But Retsuko, she...she places her titanic paws together in complete joy. (This is PERFECT! EXACTLY what I needed!) she thinks to herself excitedly. Cars stop driving to look at her, many rush out of their homes to see the enormous red panda goddess, and others begin to escape the scene out of fear for their lives. "Yes, it is I, Retsuko the goddess, and now you're ALL gonna..."
155222222222222223222111111.title: The next morning...

15522222222222222322211112.content:
Retsuko looks at her paws, mainly focusing on the Slave potion. "I guess I've never thought about this too much before but...I think I WOULD like to have a little slave of my own to either destroy, make my paw servant, or maybe even eat if I feel like it..." She giggles to herself at these ideas when she nods. "But I think my real question now is...WHO should my little pet be? Hm..." Retsuko goes inside now, thinking about who her little slave should be. But, at the same time, she also thinks about her new power at the same time—thanks to that stranger yesterday, she can finally be the dominant expression of power that she fully deserves to be. In fact, it was AL—ways meant to be this way.

Soon enough, after going inside, she bumps into...
15522222222222222322211112.title: The "Slave" potion it sure is~!

155222222222222223222111121.content:
Retsuko gasps softly to herself when she accidentally bumps into her pig boss, Ton. She has never liked working for his trade firm, and she has most certainly never enjoyed HIM. Retsuko stands there, thinking about how much she hates him. "Well, aren't you going to apologize to me, young woman?" the pig asks, stomping his foot on the ground with clear impatience written all over his old face.

"Um..."

"I am WAITING, Retsuko. Am I going to be addressed respectfully here, or will I have to give you more WORK to do?"

Upon the mention of that extra work threat, Retsuko goes dead cold. (I'm...I'm... I am DONE with this!) she yells to herself in her head. She quickly walks over to a nearby desk where Director Ton's coffee is sitting. "Where are you GOING!?" the angry pig asks, following after her. He does not reach her fast enough though, giving Retsuko the chance to pour a little of the Slave potion into his drink. "Oh, sorry Mr. Ton, but I was already bringing you your coffee back as an early show of apology. You left it back there, so...here it is. I'm sorry," Retsuko says with a smile, bowing down briefly to her boss. "Ah, I see. But I'm afraid I'm STILL going to have to give you some more work to do later," Ton says as he begins to drink his coffee again. "R-Right... Yes, sir."

Retsuko eagerly watches the pig drink his coffee down in only a single gulp. (Yes! Now let's see if it works...) Director Ton then makes a face, almost as though he tasted something awful in his coffee. "Um, you wouldn't happen to know if...someone's done anything to my coffee? It tastes...different..."

Retsuko blinks her eyes a few times as she clears her throat to respond. "Nope, I haven't seen anyone do anything to it. All I did was bring it over here for you. Honest." She gives him a smile of pure innocence. "OK... I'll go get your extra work, and then I'll be off to golf practice. It's real important stuff, you know?" Director Ton does not make it too far when he suddenly falls to the floor in shock. Retsuko smiles and hopes to herself that this is the work of the potion; and even then, she would still be alright if this were something else entirely. As long as he is suffering, right? She pretends to be concerned for Ton as she rushes up to him. "Sir are you OK!?" she asks him, holding out a paw for him to hold on to. "N—No...I'm... Ah!"

A sudden light overcomes the pig's body, trapping him in a strong state of paralysis, fear, and dizziness. "What's happening to me!?" Some workers notice, so they rush over to help. This alarms Retsuko. "Uh, i-it's OK guys! I've got it under control! Don't worry!" she frantically explains, hoping that they would all leave her and Ton alone. "Y-Yeah, you should all be...*cough*, working!" Director Ton orders, even despite the sudden rush of panic in his mind. His instructions successfully make everyone leave them both alone. Seeing this, Retsuko wipes some sweat off from her face, feeling QUITE relieved to know that no one is going to see him if it works.

Soon, the light becomes more bright, and Director Ton presumably disappears into nothing while going unconscious. The last thing that he sees is Retsuko's sweet face, smiling down at him casually as everything fades to black for him. He groans slowly, reaching a hand out for help.

. . .

"AAH!!! What the HELL!?" the pig screams, quickly finding that his surroundings are now ri-DI-culously enormous to him upon waking back up. "Uh...whoopsie?" Retsuko asks with a shy giggle, internally cheering for the success of the potion. Meanwhile, Director Ton steps back nervously as he stares back at Retsuko. She has got to be at least 150 feet tall compared to him now. Her sweet face overcomes his entire field of vision, which is quite alarming to the tiny pig. "Wh-What is the MEANING of this!? I'll have the culprit responsible for this fired as soon as I'm returned to normal!!!" he threatens. Then, he gasps when Retsuko's gigantic paw reaches forward to grab him. "Well actually, that might not happen, sir," she says with a sweet smile. "What do you mean!?" the pig asks. "Hehe, well I was just thinking to myself that, at your new size, I would..."
155222222222222223222111121.title: Director Ton
